newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam singles out Oxbow Int for power plant.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam singles out Oxbow Int for power plant.

text.p: Vietnam's state power monopoly has singled out U.S. firm Oxbow International Power Corp for talks on a roughly $300 million coal-fired generating plant in the northern province of Quang Ninh, industry sources said on Wednesday.
The sources, who declined to be named, said there would have to be several months of contract negotiations before a project licence could be granted by the ministry of planning and investment.
Several other contenders, including U.S. firm AES Transpower Private, had been in the running for the plant, Vietnam's first build-operate-transfer (BOT) power project.
The 300 MW plant, which will use low-grade coal from local mines, is expected to go into operation by 1999 and be transferred back to Electricity of Vietnam (EVN) 20 years later.
